segments.text: I find myself captivated by the woman at the sink, seemingly in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s drying dishes while water spills over the edge, forming a puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s somehow both calming and chaotic, watching her in contrast to the children.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing a stool that looks like it may tip over any second, and I feel a rush of fear.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think it’s incredible how oblivious the woman is to the risk right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him looks thrilled, raising her arm as if to catch cookies falling from heaven.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a sense of pride and worry at the same time for these mischievous kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their laughter and excitement feel contagious, and I want to smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the chaos in the kitchen makes me nervous; things could go wrong very quickly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The tranquil garden outside seems to mock the turmoil brewing inside these four walls.
segments.speaker: PAR
